title: OpenXR alert thingy
body:
Fixed it. OpenXR dialog is gone now and there's a log. There's a setting for the alert. Defaults to on, for XR users.

### Why

- The dialog was annoying when working
	- It took time to start the project
	- Had to click it every time, which was bad
- The log shows in the Errors tab and Console, like other OpenXR stuff
- Not much code changed

### My Feelings

This was a problem for me. I like Godot and wanted to do VR. The dialog was a pain because I test outside VR a lot. I'd run the project, test stuff, then later check in VR.

### Other Ways

You could turn off OpenXR, but then you have to restart. If you want VR, you change it back and restart again. 

Or you could have SteamVR running and the headset on. But sometimes it's in standby or SteamVR is off, or you just open Godot without it.

These other ways are not good for the user.

### Look

Here are some pictures of the log in the console and Errors tab.

> Usability team likes this. XR failure isn't a big deal for the engine.

That's not really true. If you only have XR, then the screen is black and you don't know what's happening. An alert saying OpenXR failed is the right thing, I think.

Maybe it should be a setting that's on by default, or different for when you're running the game vs editing.

But yeah, it should be optional to make working easier.
